channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: What is now proved was once only imagined. --William Blake https://t.co/VCoFfMWeBv

Yes, there’s outrage that the Supreme Court’s privacy has been disrupted by a leak. I guess this could pressure and politicize the Court in a new way, but the Court was not free from politics as it was. But exposing the deliberations of government to public view ain’t all bad. https://t.co/VnvNrb45MK

“There are moments in life where the question of knowing if one can think otherwise than one thinks and see otherwise than one sees is indispensable for continuing to look and reflect.” —Michel Foucault, Quotomania 210, via Paul @Holdengraber https://t.co/vwUEOUaksi
“If you don’t know what to do, there’s actually a chance of doing something new.“ —Philip Glass,Quotomania 209, via Paul @Holdengraber. https://t.co/zMu4ZWVsGQ
“I beseech you, in the bowels of Christ, think it possible you may be mistaken.” —Oliver Cromwell, Quotomania 213, via Paul @Holdengraber. https://t.co/8OoKOfmeRv

"But I am not here to theorize, not here to talk in the abstract, but to get down to the concrete subject whether or not the general strike is an effective weapon for the working class." https://t.co/csyEzlOoMJ
“I draw attention to the working minds and bodies of people who have been written off by powerful institutions.” https://t.co/8cVNYIddjz
“Metrics don't care about you as a person, and institutional rankings have nothing to do with health.” https://t.co/c2THWpduyt
@mcjsa Also, they take pleasure in applying new-to-them ideas to things that matter to them.

What’s a good college course for first-year students look like these days? Here is a fine example that asks: Are grades bullshit? The teacher sets this good colloquial question into the context of more than one serious analytical tool. #ungrading https://t.co/WIfWApQshL

Don’t get suckered. People would like to waste your time, raise your blood pressure, and ruin your mental health. Don’t let them. Don’t reply to them, usually, and don’t follow them, and don’t retweet them. https://t.co/GQdt2aJde2
Karass Longing in Twitter Time https://t.co/cFesG8jXR2
I wonder how hard it would be to catalog all the important things about the Trump years people withheld from the public until their books came out. https://t.co/4zAPni2KPz
Just back from a road trip photographing Midwestern motel pavements. https://t.co/1IqiZqZ5sh

"Parents have lots to say to their children, and children just soak it up." https://t.co/ydJAwnbGTz
Poet Phillip Larkin wrote about one of the ways this works in life. I hear that in pubs in England many a person will recite this poem from memory, if you give them a chance.
https://t.co/lxxGHfpzTl
“This stuff is complicated, and it’ll get worse with Elon deciding it’s not.” Case study of a major political actor making disingenuous use of a tweet. https://t.co/7dUzxCOXrb
“Why repeat myself?” Paul seems to be asking . . . https://t.co/CUY1toUvki
